intro: Kohleria cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf kohleria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage is often glossy and dark green, while the flowers come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Kohleria cordifolia is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
